title: Rate law for catalyzed decomposition of NH3

content.question:
<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub> <mrow> <mtext>NH</mtext> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mover> <mo>→</mo> <mrow> <mtext>catalyst</mtext> </mrow> </mover> <msub> <mtext>N</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5356@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

The catalyzed decomposition of <math alttext="N H 3 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at high temperature is represented by the equation above. The rate of disappearance of <math alttext="N H 3 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> was measured over time for two different initial concentrations of <math alttext="N H 3 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at a constant temperature. The data are plotted in the graph below.

On the basis of the data in the graph, which of the following best represents the rate law for the catalyzed decomposition of <math alttext="N H 3 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="rate equals k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of N H 3 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of N 2, times the molar concentration of H 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="rate equals k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
